diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute on Chronic Pancreatitis, Community Acquired Pneumonia
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with chest pain, cough productive of green phlegm, and diffuse abdominal pain. Vital signs indicated hypoxia and elevated WBC counts suggested an infectious process. Imaging studies revealed multifocal pneumonia and elevated lipase levels indicated pancreatitis. The combination of abdominal pain worsening with eating and associated respiratory symptoms led to the final diagnoses.
